p: In Vietnam, the co-circulation of C1, C4, and C5 subgenogroups responsible for HFMD outbreak in 2005 suggested the predominance of C5 in most affected children [ 98]. The emergence of subgenogroup C4 was implicated in a large-scale nationwide epidemic between 2011 and 2012 [ 99]. Subsequent emergence of subgenogroup B5 in 2012 became the dominant subgenogroup in 2013 [ 100]. The nationwide outbreak in Vietnam, which began in 2018, occurred after the absence of subgenogroup C4 for 6 years (Table 1 and Fig. 3) [ 101].
